column4: SSD question:  The last time I used 10.10 on an SSD the hardware failed.  The corrupted everything had to return it, this was like 3 months ago or so.  Now i installed 10.10 on another SSD and the hardware SSD failed AGAIN!  does unbuntu 10.10 not good with SSD's ???
well ssd have a limited write life,  I wonder if ubuntu is writing at some high interval?
the first one lasted like 2 hours, this last one like 3 weeks
im running 9.10 right now flawlessly for like 3 months now.
well I guess you can look at iotop and get an idea of what trafic is put on your ssd device.  I can't imagin it could kill it that quick
what is this "iotop" ive never heard of it and i dont know how to read the output :(
at what mount point did you put this ssd that died in 10.10?
mount point?  the default one the installer uses
try man iotop or google it.  it will display the trafic to io devices
does that include the swap partition?
yes
well that might kill it in some short time if you put alot of trafic on swap
so you recommend doing away with swap?
well I would analize were the trafic might be coming from before makeing any judgment
im on a SSD with 9.10 it seems fine.  The problem is with 10.10.  I'm scared im just going to trash ANOTHER 60GB SSD.
and if not much trafic can be seen maybe it's just bad hardware
but TWO SSD's ?
ya and one it two hours?  you can analize trafic on 10.10 without the ssd to verify
not sure i understand completely your last sentence :(
try 10.10 on a system that has no ssd like normal hdd and do the measurment with iotop or other there
got cha
